data.title: Academic Achievement Commemorated at Keuka College's Honors Convocation
data.meta_description: Nearly 90 students were recognized for their dedication to academic excellence.
data.text:
Keuka College held its annual Honors Convocation ceremony on Saturday, May 4.

Held each spring, the ceremony recognizes Keuka College students who have demonstrated excellence in their field of study or in service to the College community. Students also earned recognition for demonstrating leadership outside of the classroom.

“The students we’ve honored have worked hard to earn the accolades they’ve received,” said College President Amy Storey. “We’ve celebrated the highest achievers among the student body. The recipients challenged themselves and dedicated themselves to the pursuit of academic excellence. I’m proud of every one of them, and the distinction they bring to Keuka College.”

Nearly 90 students were recognized for their distinguished academic achievements:

Division of Natural Science & Mathematics

CRC Freshman Chemistry Achievement Award: Brenden Crotty

American Chemical Society Senior Chemistry Prize: Devyn Scheidt

James E. White Freshman Biology Award: Gabriella Hall

Hazel Ellis Loomis Award: Lily McLaughlin

Biology Outstanding Senior Award: Devyn Scheidt

Environmental Science Award: Suzanne Ward

Environmental Science Outstanding Senior Award: Hannah Lynch

Judd Prize in Mathematics: Erin Schock

Shortt Prize in Mathematics: Quinn Toomey

Division of Criminal Justice & Social Work

Social Responsibility & Volunteerism Award in Social Work: Samantha Farone

Values & Ethics Award in Social Work: Madalyn Merkt, Kayla Suppa, Aubrianna Renfrew

Cesar Chavez Award in Social Work: Rosabella Francis

Leadership Award in Social Work: Phoebe Bates

Academic Excellence in Social Work: Brendan Mavretish

Jane Addams Award in Social Work: Lauren Michels

Senior Achievement Award in Criminology & Criminal Justice: Spencer Rosen

Division of Education & Psychology

Dr. Michael A. Rogoff Award in Psychology: Julianna McGory

Academic Excellence in Education Award, Sophomore: Garrett Fleming, Reagan Schlimgen, Cassidy Gage

Academic Excellence in Education Award, Junior: Annalise Steier, Sydney Haust

Academic Excellence in Education Award, Senior: Sarah Paradisio, Sara Bourdon, Felicia Cotroneo

Education Divisional Honors: Savannah Taylor, Claire Stapleton, Taegan Sharp

Lambda Theta Lambda Education Honor Society: Sara Bourdon, Felicia Cotroneo, Grace DeCapua, Mary Hennessy, Casey Hunziker, Elizabeth Nau, Jordan Nichols, Sarah Paradisio, Brooke Russell, Taegan Sharp, McKenna Snyder, Claire Stapleton, Savannah Taylor, Emily VanDelinder, Ty Zepp

Division of Humanities & Fine Arts

Sprague Prize in History: Konnor Nakashiki

Outstanding Senior in Political Science & History: Caleb Cansdale

Marcia Clark Cooley ’28 Scholarship: Nathaniel Clark

Margaret Davenport Springer Memorial Prize in English: Cassian Allport

J. Stanley Durkee Prize in Poetry: Morgan Farewell

Crooked Lake Collections Awards: Peyton Taylor, Andrew Hansen

Division of Business & Management

Marketing Award for Outstanding Achievement: Zachary Smith

Outstanding Business Student Awards: Ezeke Pulliam, William Tehan

Management Award for Outstanding Academic Achievement: Owen Thorpe

Accounting Award for Outstanding Academic Achievement: Matthew Vaccaro

Division of Applied Health & Wellness

Pi Theta Epsilon Honor Society: Josie Kelley, Chloe LaCroix, Kathleen Stewart, Samantha Tartaglia

Future Occupational Therapy Practitioner Award: Kaylie Wilson

The Occupational Therapy Award for Academic Excellence: Cameron Knapp

The Award for Excellence in Clinical Reasoning: Olivia Santana

Leadership in Occupational Therapy Award: Christina Bard

The Peter Talty Graduate Scholarship for Occupational Therapy: Sydney Brown

The Anastasia Alisa McManus ’14 Memorial Scholarship: Sawyer Richardson

Barbara Neuhaus Scholarship: Josie Kelley, Kathleen Stewart, Kaylie Wilson

Applied Health and Wellness Award: Ashley Thompson, Chloe Skutt

Professional Development, Leadership, and Scholarship Program: Christina Bard, Madeline Branius, Shaelyn Diamond, Abbagail Flack, Josie Kelley, Olivia Santana, Samantha Farone, Kayla Suppa
